question: Why do you think is that?
transcript: you know, many products are user-friendly. They have complete instructions, and, you know, customers can read the instructions thoroughly and find it easy to use with that, I mean, appliances or maybe electronic gadgets. But many of those products don have beneficial instruction for their customers So I think this is the main point Okay so do you think that that the reason why some people find it uncomfortable to use new products at home or at work Well this is one of the reasons Another reason is that many people don want to change at all They like to stick to their routines and they don want to explore new things and find many useful things I mean around them And because of that I think people need to accept some minor changes in their lives in order to embrace new things.

anti_overrating.reason: 'products don have' (don't have). 'find it easy to use with that' (to use them). 'beneficial instruction' (useful instructions).

question: Do you think that advertisements play a key role in promoting innovative and trendy products these days?
transcript: actually, advertisements are somehow inducing and makes people, make people infuriated sometimes. They also use some, you know, slogans and catchy slogans and some gimmicks to attract the customers, but I think they will not be sufficient.

question: And do you like your job?

question: And what do you like to do in your free time?

So, yeah, that is what I do when I, like, in my free time. So, now we are going to talk about sitting down.

question: My favorite place to sit down?
transcript: I would say, I would say my favorite place to sit down at this moment would be in a, Like I live close to the Grand Park in Seoul. So, and I go for, I go for like walk, I go for a run a lot in the park and I like to sit down. Just like space out and like sometimes I listen to the music and sometimes I like listen to nothing. And yeah, literally doing nothing like just being, existing. So yeah, that is what I like to do.

question: And do you feel sleepy when you are sitting down?

question: And, why do you think some people in large cities do not know their neighbors?
transcript: Because, you know, like, this generation, this society is, like, really busy and also, just the apartment blocks, like, flood. it is, like, completely separated and everyone wants to have their, like, own private place. So, also everyone has, like, different, like, routines. People wake up like, like really early in the morning or something like, if the people like work in the night, they like to sleep in the morning. So if the schedule does not really match, they do not really get to see each other. So that is why, yeah. Yes, yes.

question: And do you think it is important to know your neighbors or is it okay not to know them?
transcript: It is okay not to know them, but it is, I think I would say it is better to know them because, you know, like you never know what is going to happen. Like for example, you might literally like, for example if you have like some, like health conditions and if you like literally fainted on the floor, like if you know your neighbor then they might know like something's going on to me so they might like reach out and if I do not respond they can like call the police or something so like, but if I do not know, like if I like literally do not know them and if I have, if I am going through like some difficult times then Yeah it going to be difficult to like ask for help So I think it better to know like make some like get to know their neighbors yes And when we think about children how do children build relationships with others in a community they go to either like, you know, like nursery or playground to like get to know them first. Just, like, hang out, like, you know, having, like, small chats, and, like, do some kind of, like, activities together. Like, for example, like, reading together, or, like, if an organization, like, for example, the nursery is, like, holding an event, then, yeah, they get to participate together, like, just interact with each other. So, yeah, that is how kids get to know each other.

anti_overrating.reason: 'something's going on to me' (going on with me). 'it going to be' (it is going to be). 'it better to know' (it is better).

ielts_descriptor_alignment.grammar_text: Produces frequent error-free sentences.
